definition: to work a temporary or casual job/(of students) to have a job outside of class time, or during vacation
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from

sentences.english: She is in a different city as a factory worker.
sentences.chinese: 她的媽媽阮和平在另一座城市的工廠打工。

sentences.english: He frequently to Wang Jing wage restaurant meals, and when the waiter asked her designated.
sentences.chinese: 他頻繁來王靜打工的餐館喫飯，並指定要她當服務員。

sentences.english: I've never worked for money before, not counting my chores at home.
sentences.chinese: 除了在家乾點過點雜活，我還從來沒有打工賺過錢呢。

sentences.english: On any free time, she would have the obnoxiously busy job at the coffee shop across the street from campus.
sentences.chinese: 空餘的時間會在學校對街熱鬧的咖啡店打工。

sentences.english: As a student I jobbed during the semester breaks.
sentences.chinese: 作爲一名學生，我在假期打工。

sentences.english: Tyson Foods was charged with smuggling illegal immigrants to work in meat packing plants.
sentences.chinese: 泰森食品公司被指控偷運非法移民在肉食包裝廠打工。

sentences.english: I worked in a small beachside restaurant during the college vacation.
sentences.chinese: 學院放假時，我在海濱的一家小餐館裏打工。

sentences.english: Working along the way is another option.
sentences.chinese: 邊走邊打工則是另一種選擇。

sentences.english: The summer vacation began. I decided to work to make money for the next term.
sentences.chinese: 暑假開始了，我決定打工爲下學期掙些錢。

sentences.english: Emmanuel profit margin part-time job, and learn, get a good result.
sentences.chinese: 埃利邊打工，邊學習，獲得了很好的成果。

sentences.english: A friend helped me find my first job as a general labour in City of Mississauga.
sentences.chinese: 經朋友介紹，我在密西沙加市找到了第一份打工。

sentences.english: The day the second child was born, their migrant-worker days were over.
sentences.chinese: 從生老二那天起，兩口子的打工生活就結束了。

sentences.english: Man stabs one to death, injures 4 .
sentences.chinese: 常州禮嘉一打工者刺死一人，刺傷4人。

sentences.english: Golden flowers to the food factory jobs, what accidentally met the directors son.
sentences.chinese: 金花到食品廠打工還債，偶然結識了廠長的兒子楊帆。

sentences.english: The husband sent the first working Lai Hang, she was really a bit worried.
sentences.chinese: 這次送丈夫第一次來杭打工，她心裏真有點不放心。

sentences.english: Nowadays, part-time job is very popular on university campus.
sentences.chinese: 如今，大學校園裏的業餘打工是一個非常普遍的現象。

definition: to drop out of school/to leave off studying/to interrupt one's studies
to seek one's livelihood/to work to support oneself/to earn a living
to work hard/to try to make a living
to make a hard living as unskilled laborer
to support one's family (idiom); to have difficulty feeding a family
native place/place of origin/home state or region
to release from work at the end of the day
to go to school/to attend school
to go to work/to be on duty/to start work/to go to the office
